description:
Software installed and run as a non-privileged user may conduct improper GPU system calls to issue reads and writes to arbitrary physical memory pages.

Under certain circumstances this exploit could be used to corrupt data pages not allocated by the GPU driver but memory pages in use by the kernel and drivers running on the platform, altering their behaviour.
summary: This vulnerability allows malicious software running as a regular user to access and modify data in the computer's memory, potentially causing the system to behave unexpectedly. It affects users who run software with GPU capabilities. To protect against this, users should update their software and operating systems to patch the vulnerability.

description: Software installed and run as a non-privileged user may conduct improper GPU system calls to corrupt kernel heap memory.
summary: This vulnerability allows software run by a non-privileged user to corrupt kernel heap memory through improper GPU system calls. This could potentially affect any system with a GPU. To mitigate the risk, users should ensure they are running the latest updates and patches for their operating system and GPU drivers.

description:
SIMPLE.ERP client is vulnerable to MS SQL protocol downgrade request from a server side, what could lead to an unencrypted communication vulnerable to data interception and modification.

This issue affect SIMPLE.ERP from 6.20 to 6.30. Only the 6.30 version received a patch 6.30@a03.9, which make it possible for an administrator to enforce encrypted communication. Versions 6.20 and 6.25 remain unpatched.
summary: The vulnerability in SIMPLE.ERP client allows for unencrypted communication that is susceptible to data interception and modification. This affects versions 6.20 to 6.30, with only version 6.30 receiving a patch to enforce encrypted communication. Users of versions 6.20 and 6.25 should take action to update to the patched version to protect their data.

description:
The SIMPLE.ERP client stores superuser password in a recoverable format, allowing any authenticated SIMPLE.ERP user to escalate privileges to a database administrator.

This issue affect SIMPLE.ERP from 6.20 through 6.30. Only the 6.30 version received a patch 6.30@a03.9, which removed the vulnerability. Versions 6.20 and 6.25 remain unpatched.
summary: A vulnerability in SIMPLE.ERP allows any authenticated user to access the superuser password and escalate their privileges to a database administrator. This affects versions 6.20 through 6.30, but only version 6.30 has a patch available to fix the issue. Users of versions 6.20 and 6.25 should take action to secure their systems and consider upgrading to the patched version.

description: API Platform Core is a system to create hypermedia-driven REST and GraphQL APIs. Starting in version 3.3.8, a security check that gets called after GraphQl resolvers is always replaced by another one as there's no break in a clause. summary: The vulnerability in API Platform Core version 3.3.8 allows for a security check to be replaced, potentially impacting the security of GraphQL APIs. Users are advised to update to version 3.3.15 which contains a patch for this issue.

The manipulation of the argument File leads to unrestricted upload. It is possible to launch the attack remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used. The vendor was contacted early about this disclosure but did not respond in any way.
summary: A critical vulnerability has been found in Digiwin ERP 5.1 that allows for unrestricted file uploads through a specific function. This vulnerability can be exploited remotely and has been disclosed publicly. Users of Digiwin ERP 5.1 should be aware of this threat and take immediate action to secure their systems, such as applying patches or updates if available or implementing additional security measures to prevent unauthorized access. The vendor has not responded to the disclosure, so users should proactively protect their systems.

description: HCL DevOps Deploy / HCL Launch could allow a remote privileged authenticated attacker to execute arbitrary commands on the system by sending specially crafted input containing special elements.
summary: This vulnerability in HCL DevOps Deploy / HCL Launch could allow an attacker with authorization to execute commands on the system remotely. This could potentially affect anyone using these software products. To mitigate this threat, users should apply the necessary security updates provided by HCL.

description: Kyverno is a policy engine designed for cloud native platform engineering teams. Prior to version 1.14.0-alpha.1, Kyverno ignores subjectRegExp and IssuerRegExp while verifying artifact's sign with keyless mode. It allows the attacker to deploy kubernetes resources with the artifacts that were signed by unexpected certificate. Deploying these unauthorized kubernetes resources can lead to full compromise of kubernetes cluster. Version 1.14.0-alpha.1 contains a patch for the issue.
summary: A vulnerability in Kyverno, a policy engine used by cloud native platform engineering teams, allows attackers to deploy unauthorized Kubernetes resources that can compromise the entire cluster. Users should update to version 1.14.0-alpha.1 to patch this issue.

description: On 70mai Dash Cam 1S devices, by connecting directly to the dashcam's network and accessing the API on port 80 and RTSP on port 554, an attacker can bypass the device authorization mechanism from the official mobile app that requires a user to physically press on the power button during a connection.
summary: The CVE involves a security vulnerability in 70mai Dash Cam 1S devices, which allows attackers to bypass the device authorization mechanism by connecting directly to the dashcam's network. This vulnerability can potentially affect users of the 70mai Dash Cam 1S device. To mitigate this threat, users should ensure their devices are updated with the latest security patches and consider limiting network access to the device to prevent unauthorized connections.

description: kanidim-provision is a helper utility that uses kanidm's API to provision users, groups and oauth2 systems. Prior to version 1.2.0, a faulty function intrumentation in the (optional) kanidm patches provided by kandim-provision will cause the provisioned admin credentials to be leaked to the system log. This only impacts users which both use the provided patches and provision their `admin` or `idm_admin` account credentials this way. No other credentials are affected. Users should recompile kanidm with the newest patchset from tag `v1.2.0` or higher. As a workaround, the user can set the log level `KANIDM_LOG_LEVEL` to any level higher than `info`, for example `warn`.
summary: A vulnerability in kanidm-provision prior to version 1.2.0 can cause admin credentials to be leaked to the system log. This only affects users who use the provided patches and provision their admin or idm_admin account credentials this way. To mitigate this issue, users should recompile kanidm with the newest patchset from tag v1.2.0 or higher. A workaround is to set the log level KANIDM_LOG_LEVEL to a level higher than info, such as warn.

description: Vite, a provider of frontend development tooling, has a vulnerability in versions prior to 6.2.3, 6.1.2, 6.0.12, 5.4.15, and 4.5.10. `@fs` denies access to files outside of Vite serving allow list. Adding `?raw??` or `?import&raw??` to the URL bypasses this limitation and returns the file content if it exists. This bypass exists because trailing separators such as `?` are removed in several places, but are not accounted for in query string regexes. The contents of arbitrary files can be returned to the browser. Only apps explicitly exposing the Vite dev server to the network (using `--host` or `server.host` config option) are affected. Versions 6.2.3, 6.1.2, 6.0.12, 5.4.15, and 4.5.10 fix the issue.
summary: This CVE affects Vite, a provider of frontend development tooling, in versions prior to 6.2.3, 6.1.2, 6.0.12, 5.4.15, and 4.5.10. The vulnerability allows attackers to bypass file access restrictions and view the content of files outside of the allowed list by adding specific strings to the URL. Only apps that expose the Vite dev server to the network are affected. Users should update to versions 6.2.3, 6.1.2, 6.0.12, 5.4.15, or 4.5.10 to fix this issue and prevent potential unauthorized access to files.

description:
Spring Security 6.4.0 - 6.4.3 may not correctly locate method security annotations on parameterized types or methods. This may cause an authorization bypass. 

You are not affected if you are not using @EnableMethodSecurity, or
you do not have method security annotations on parameterized types or methods, or all method security annotations are attached to target methods
summary: A vulnerability in Spring Security versions 6.4.0 to 6.4.3 may allow unauthorized access due to a flaw in locating method security annotations. This could affect users who use @EnableMethodSecurity or have method security annotations on parameterized types or methods. To prevent this, users should ensure method security annotations are only attached to target methods or consider not using @EnableMethodSecurity.

description: A vulnerability classified as critical was found in Digiwin ERP 5.0.1. Affected by this vulnerability is an unknown functionality of the file /Api/TinyMce/UploadAjaxAPI.ashx. The manipulation of the argument File leads to unrestricted upload. The attack can be launched remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used. The vendor was contacted early about this disclosure but did not respond in any way.

The vendor has not responded to the disclosure, so users should take immediate action to mitigate the threat by implementing necessary security measures or patches provided by the vendor, if available.

description: A vulnerability, which was classified as critical, has been found in zhijiantianya ruoyi-vue-pro 2.4.1. Affected by this issue is some unknown functionality of the file /app-api/infra/file/upload of the component Front-End Store Interface. The manipulation of the argument path leads to path traversal. The attack may be launched remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used. The vendor was contacted early about this disclosure but did not respond in any way.
summary: This critical vulnerability in zhijiantianya ruoyi-vue-pro 2.4.1 allows for remote attackers to perform a path traversal attack through the /app-api/infra/file/upload file of the Front-End Store Interface component. The exploit has been made public and can affect users of this software. Users should take immediate action to update to a patched version or implement any available security measures to protect against this attack. It is concerning that the vendor has not responded to this disclosure.

description: An authentication bypass vulnerability in Kentico Xperience allows authentication bypass via the Staging Sync Server password handling of empty SHA1 usernames in digest authentication. Authentication bypass allows an attacker to control administrative objects.This issue affects Xperience through 13.0.172.
summary: This vulnerability in Kentico Xperience allows attackers to bypass authentication and take control of administrative objects. It affects versions up to 13.0.172. Users should update to a patched version to protect against this threat.

description: An authentication bypass vulnerability in Kentico Xperience allows authentication bypass via the Staging Sync Server component password handling for the server defined None type. Authentication bypass allows an attacker to control administrative objects.This issue affects Xperience through 13.0.178.
summary: This vulnerability in Kentico Xperience allows attackers to bypass authentication and gain control of administrative objects. It affects versions up to 13.0.178. Users should update to the latest version of Kentico Xperience to fix this issue and prevent unauthorized access.

description: The Kentico Xperience application does not fully validate or filter files uploaded via the multiple-file upload functionality, which allows for stored XSS.This issue affects Kentico Xperience through 13.0.178.
summary: This vulnerability in Kentico Xperience allows attackers to upload malicious files through the multiple-file upload feature, leading to stored cross-site scripting attacks. This affects users of Kentico Xperience up to version 13.0.178. To protect against this threat, users should update to the latest version of Kentico Xperience and avoid uploading files from untrusted sources.

description: An authenticated remote code execution in Kentico Xperience allows authenticated users Staging Sync Server to upload arbitrary data to path relative locations. This results in path traversal and arbitrary file upload, including content that can be executed server side leading to remote code execution.This issue affects Kentico Xperience through 13.0.178.
summary: This vulnerability in Kentico Xperience allows authenticated users to upload malicious files to the server, potentially leading to remote code execution. Users of Kentico Xperience through version 13.0.178 are affected. Users should update to a patched version of the software to prevent exploitation of this issue.

description: Cilium is a networking, observability, and security solution with an eBPF-based dataplane. For Cilium users who use Gateway API for Ingress for some services and use LB-IPAM or BGP for LB Service implementation and use network policies to block egress traffic from workloads in a namespace to workloads in other namespaces, egress traffic from workloads covered by such network policies to LoadBalancers configured by `Gateway` resources will incorrectly be allowed. LoadBalancer resources not deployed via a Gateway API configuration are not affected by this issue. This issue affects: Cilium v1.15 between v1.15.0 and v1.15.14 inclusive, v1.16 between v1.16.0 and v1.16.7 inclusive, and v1.17 between v1.17.0 and v1.17.1 inclusive. This issue is fixed in Cilium v1.15.15, v1.16.8, and v1.17.2. A Clusterwide Cilium Network Policy can be used to work around this issue for users who are unable to upgrade.
summary: This CVE affects Cilium users who use Gateway API for Ingress, LB-IPAM or BGP for LB Service implementation, and network policies to block egress traffic from workloads in one namespace to workloads in other namespaces. Egress traffic from workloads covered by these network policies to LoadBalancers configured by `Gateway` resources may be incorrectly allowed. Users of Cilium versions between v1.15.0 and v1.15.14, v1.16.0 and v1.16.7, and v1.17.0 and v1.17.1 are affected. To address this issue, users should upgrade to Cilium v1.15.15, v1.16.8, or v1.17.2. If an upgrade is not possible, a Clusterwide Cilium Network Policy can be used as a workaround.

description: Cilium is a networking, observability, and security solution with an eBPF-based dataplane. Node based network policies (`fromNodes` and `toNodes`) will incorrectly permit traffic to/from non-node endpoints that share the labels specified in `fromNodes` and `toNodes` sections of network policies. Node based network policy is disabled by default in Cilium. This issue affects: Cilium v1.16 between v1.16.0 and v1.16.7 inclusive and v1.17 between v1.17.0 and v1.17.1 inclusive. This issue is fixed in Cilium v1.16.8 and v1.17.2. Users can work around this issue by ensuring that the labels used in `fromNodes` and `toNodes` fields are used exclusively by nodes and not by other endpoints.
summary: A vulnerability in Cilium networking solution allows traffic to/from non-node endpoints that share specific labels in network policies. This affects Cilium versions 1.16.0 to 1.16.7 and 1.17.0 to 1.17.1. Users should update to Cilium versions 1.16.8 or 1.17.2 to fix the issue. Alternatively, users can ensure that labels in network policies are only used by nodes and not other endpoints.

description:
PDF-XChange Editor RTF File Parsing Out-Of-Bounds Read Remote Code Execution Vulnerability. This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of PDF-XChange Editor. User interaction is required to exploit this vulnerability in that the target must visit a malicious page or open a malicious file.

The specific flaw exists within the parsing of RTF files. The issue results from the lack of proper validation of user-supplied data, which can result in a read past the end of an allocated buffer. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to execute code in the context of the current process. Was ZDI-CAN-25473.
summary: This vulnerability in PDF-XChange Editor allows remote attackers to run code on affected systems by tricking users into opening a malicious file or visiting a malicious webpage. The flaw is in the parsing of RTF files and can be exploited to read past the end of a buffer. Users should update their software to the latest version to protect against this vulnerability.

This affects an unknown part of the file /admin-api/infra/file/upload of the component Backend File Upload Interface. The manipulation of the argument path leads to path traversal. It is possible to initiate the attack remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used. The vendor was contacted early about this disclosure but did not respond in any way.
summary: A critical vulnerability was found in zhijiantianya ruoyi-vue-pro 2.4.1, specifically in the /admin-api/infra/file/upload component. description: Tenda AC8 V16.03.34.06 is vulnerable to Buffer Overflow in the fromSetRouteStatic function via the parameter list.
summary: The Tenda AC8 V16.03.34.06 router is vulnerable to a Buffer Overflow threat through a specific function. This vulnerability can be exploited by attackers to potentially gain unauthorized access to the router and its connected devices. Users of this router should update to the latest firmware version to mitigate this threat.

description: A stack-based buffer overflow vulnerability in Tenda AC7 V15.03.06.44 allows a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code through a stack overflow attack using the security parameter of the formWifiBasicSet function.
summary: This CVE is a security issue in Tenda AC7 V15.03.06.44 routers that allows a remote attacker to remotely run malicious code on the affected device. This vulnerability can affect anyone using this specific model of router. To protect against this threat, users should update their router's firmware to the latest version provided by Tenda.

description: An issue in onos v2.7.0 allows attackers to trigger a packet deserialization problem when supplying a crafted LLDP packet. This vulnerability allows attackers to execute arbitrary commands or access network information.
summary: A vulnerability in onos v2.7.0 could allow attackers to execute harmful commands or access network information by sending a specific type of LLDP packet. This could affect users of this version of onos and potentially compromise network security. Users should update to a patched version to mitigate this threat.

description: Limited secret space in LLDP packets used in onos v2.7.0 allows attackers to obtain the private key via a bruteforce attack. Attackers are able to leverage this vulnerability into creating crafted LLDP packets.
summary: This CVE affects users of onos v2.7.0, a network operating system. The vulnerability allows attackers to obtain the private key of LLDP packets through a brute force attack, which can be used to create malicious packets. To protect against this threat, users should update their software to the latest version and regularly monitor network traffic for any suspicious activity.

description: An issue in onos v2.7.0 allows attackers to trigger unexpected behavior within a device connected to a legacy switch via changing the link type from indirect to direct.
summary: CVE in the ONOS software version 2.7.0 allows attackers to manipulate the behavior of a device connected to a legacy switch by changing the link type. This vulnerability affects users of ONOS software version 2.7.0. To mitigate this threat, users should update to a patched version of the software as soon as possible.

description: Use of incorrectly resolved name or reference in OpenDaylight Service Function Chaining (SFC) Subproject SFC Sodium-SR4 and below allows attackers to cause a Denial of Service (DoS).
summary: This vulnerability in the OpenDaylight Service Function Chaining (SFC) software can be exploited by attackers to cause a Denial of Service (DoS) attack. software: OpenDaylight Service Function Chaining (SFC) Subproject SFC Sodium-SR4

This could be exploited through a man-in-the-middle attack. Users of this software should update to a version that includes a secure fix to prevent unauthorized access to sensitive data.
software: OpenDaylight Service Function Chaining (SFC) Subproject SFC Sodium-SR4

summary: This vulnerability in the OpenDaylight Service Function Chaining software allows attackers to perform high-level actions by sending a specific request. description:
SnapCenter versions prior to

 system where a SnapCenter plug-in has been installed.

The manipulation leads to path traversal. The attack can be initiated remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used. The vendor was contacted early about this disclosure but did not respond in any way.

The vulnerability has been made public and the vendor has not responded to address the issue. Users should be aware of potential attacks and take precautions to protect their systems.

description: A security issue was discovered in  ingress-nginx https://github.com/kubernetes/ingress-nginx  where the `auth-tls-match-cn` Ingress annotation can be used to inject configuration into nginx. This can lead to arbitrary code execution in the context of the ingress-nginx controller, and disclosure of Secrets accessible to the controller. (Note that in the default installation, the controller can access all Secrets cluster-wide.)
summary: The CVE is a security issue in the ingress-nginx software, which is used in Kubernetes. By using a specific Ingress annotation, attackers can inject configuration into nginx, leading to potential arbitrary code execution and disclosure of sensitive Secrets. This can affect anyone using the ingress-nginx controller. Users should update their ingress-nginx software to the latest version to fix this vulnerability.

description: A security issue was discovered in  ingress-nginx https://github.com/kubernetes/ingress-nginx  where the `mirror-target` and `mirror-host` Ingress annotations can be used to inject arbitrary configuration into nginx. This can lead to arbitrary code execution in the context of the ingress-nginx controller, and disclosure of Secrets accessible to the controller. (Note that in the default installation, the controller can access all Secrets cluster-wide.)
summary: The security issue found in ingress-nginx allows attackers to inject arbitrary configuration into nginx, potentially leading to arbitrary code execution and disclosure of sensitive information. This affects users of the ingress-nginx controller in Kubernetes. To mitigate the threat, users should update their ingress-nginx to a patched version and avoid using the `mirror-target` and `mirror-host` Ingress annotations.

description: A security issue was discovered in Kubernetes where under certain conditions, an unauthenticated attacker with access to the pod network can achieve arbitrary code execution in the context of the ingress-nginx controller. This can lead to disclosure of Secrets accessible to the controller. (Note that in the default installation, the controller can access all Secrets cluster-wide.)
summary: This security vulnerability in Kubernetes allows an unauthenticated attacker to execute code and access sensitive information. It affects users of Kubernetes using the ingress-nginx controller. To protect against this issue, users should update their Kubernetes installation to the latest version that includes the necessary security patches.

description: A security issue was discovered in  ingress-nginx https://github.com/kubernetes/ingress-nginx  where attacker-provided data are included in a filename by the ingress-nginx Admission Controller feature, resulting in directory traversal within the container. This could result in denial of service, or when combined with other vulnerabilities, limited disclosure of Secret objects from the cluster.
summary: This security issue in ingress-nginx allows attackers to access files outside of the intended directory, potentially causing denial of service or unauthorized access to sensitive information like Secret objects in a Kubernetes cluster. Users should update to the latest version of ingress-nginx to mitigate this vulnerability.

description: A security issue was discovered in  ingress-nginx https://github.com/kubernetes/ingress-nginx  where the `auth-url` Ingress annotation can be used to inject configuration into nginx. This can lead to arbitrary code execution in the context of the ingress-nginx controller, and disclosure of Secrets accessible to the controller. (Note that in the default installation, the controller can access all Secrets cluster-wide.)
summary: The CVE in the ingress-nginx software allows attackers to inject configuration and potentially execute arbitrary code in the system. This can lead to the disclosure of sensitive information like Secrets. This vulnerability affects users of the ingress-nginx software. To mitigate this threat, users are advised to update the software to the latest version as soon as possible.

description: A vulnerability, which was classified as critical, has been found in D-Link DIR-823X 240126/240802. This issue affects the function sub_41710C of the file /goform/diag_nslookup of the component HTTP POST Request Handler. The manipulation of the argument target_addr leads to os command injection. The attack may be initiated remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used.

This could potentially lead to unauthorized access or control of the router. description: A vulnerability was found in GNOME libgsf up to 1.14.53 and classified as problematic. Affected by this issue is the function gsf_base64_encode_simple. The manipulation of the argument size leads to use of uninitialized variable. The attack needs to be approached locally. The vendor was contacted early about this disclosure but did not respond in any way.
summary: The vulnerability in GNOME libgsf can be exploited locally by manipulating an argument to cause the use of uninitialized variable, potentially leading to a security breach. This issue affects versions up to 1.14.53. Users should update to a patched version as soon as possible to mitigate the risk of exploitation. The vendor has been notified but has not responded.

description: A vulnerability was found in GNOME libgsf up to 1.14.53. It has been classified as critical. This affects the function gsf_base64_encode_simple. The manipulation of the argument size_t leads to heap-based buffer overflow. An attack has to be approached locally. The vendor was contacted early about this disclosure but did not respond in any way.
summary: This CVE involves a critical vulnerability in GNOME libgsf up to version 1.14.53. This vulnerability affects users of GNOME libgsf up to version 1.14.53. To mitigate the threat, users should update to the latest version of GNOME libgsf as soon as possible.

description: A vulnerability was found in GNOME libgsf up to 1.14.53. It has been declared as critical. This vulnerability affects the function gsf_prop_settings_collect_va. The manipulation of the argument n_alloced_params leads to heap-based buffer overflow. Local access is required to approach this attack. summary: This vulnerability in GNOME libgsf up to version 1.14.53 allows for a critical heap-based buffer overflow attack if a specific function is manipulated. This vulnerability only affects users who have local access on their system. The vendor was notified but did not respond to the disclosure. The manipulation of the argument n_alloced_params leads to heap-based buffer overflow. Attacking locally is a requirement. The manipulation of the argument Name leads to out-of-bounds read. It is possible to launch the attack on the local host. description: A vulnerability classified as critical was found in H3C Magic NX15, Magic NX30 Pro, Magic NX400, Magic R3010 and Magic BE18000 up to V100R014. Affected by this vulnerability is an unknown functionality of the file /api/login/auth of the component HTTP POST Request Handler. The manipulation leads to command injection. The attack can be launched remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used. The vendor was contacted early about this disclosure but did not respond in any way.

description: Mbed TLS before 2.28.10 and 3.x before 3.6.3, on the client side, accepts servers that have trusted certificates for arbitrary hostnames unless the TLS client application calls mbedtls_ssl_set_hostname.

description: A flaw was found in Keycloak. When the configuration uses JWT tokens for authentication, the tokens are cached until expiration. If a client uses JWT tokens with an excessively long expiration time, for example, 24 or 48 hours, the cache can grow indefinitely, leading to an OutOfMemoryError. This issue could result in a denial of service condition, preventing legitimate users from accessing the system.
summary: The flaw in Keycloak allows for an OutOfMemoryError to occur when using JWT tokens with excessively long expiration times, potentially leading to a denial of service attack. This affects systems using Keycloak for authentication. To mitigate this issue, users should ensure that JWT tokens have appropriate expiration times to prevent the cache from growing indefinitely.

description:
Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an SQL Command ('SQL Injection') vulnerability in Apache VCL. Users can modify form data submitted when requesting a new Block Allocation such that a SELECT SQL statement is modified. The data returned by the SELECT statement is not viewable by the attacker.

This issue affects all versions of Apache VCL from 2.2 through 2.5.1.

Users are recommended to upgrade to version 2.5.2, which fixes the issue.
summary: The Apache VCL software is vulnerable to an 'SQL Injection' attack, where users can modify form data to alter SQL commands and potentially access sensitive data. This vulnerability affects all versions of Apache VCL from 2.2 through 2.5.1. Users should upgrade to version 2.5.2 to protect against this threat.

description:
Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting') vulnerability in Apache VCL in the User Lookup form. A user with sufficient rights to be able to view this part of the site can craft a URL or be tricked in to clicking a URL that will give a specified user elevated rights.



This issue affects all versions of Apache VCL through 2.5.1.



Users are recommended to upgrade to version 2.5.2, which fixes the issue.
summary: The Apache VCL software has a vulnerability that allows a user to manipulate a URL link and gain elevated rights on the website. This affects all versions of Apache VCL up to 2.5.1. To mitigate this threat, users should update their software to version 2.5.2, which includes a fix for this issue.
